content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-226-12-A
|Item_parent=Deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism (see item 330)
|Item_parent_short=Deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism (see item 330)
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing contraception contraindicated in cases of VTE (DVT, PE)
|Description=None
|Topic=Management
|Contributors=Gilles Pernod, Virginie Dufrost, Guillaume Mahé
|Order=12}}
In case of a history of MVTE:

- any form of contraception containing oestrogen is contraindicated

- Another method of contraception should be offered, mainly a micro-progestogen pill or intra-uterine device.

question.question: In cases of a history of major venous thromboembolism (MVTE), which of the following contraceptive methods is generally contraindicated?
question.option_a: Any form of contraception containing oestrogen
